title: The Bachelorette: The 'secret truce' that left producers 'furious and scrambling to create drama'
text:
The Bachelorette's Jamie Doran is set to cause drama during Wednesday's episode by breaking a 'secret truce' Angie Kent's contestants made behind the scenes.

During the early days of filming in July, each of the men agreed they would no longer interrupt each other as they enjoyed alone time with Angie at cocktail parties.

However, Daily Mail Australia can reveal that as soon as producers discovered the peaceful plan, they intervened to ensure there was TV worthy bust-ups.

Villain? The Bachelorette's Jamie Doran (pictured) is set to cause drama during Wednesday's episode by breaking a 'secret truce' Angie Kent's contestants made behind the scenes

An on set source says: 'Some of the producers were furious when they found out and were scrambling to create drama and break up the truce.

'Without the boys interrupting each other and fighting for Angie's attention, they'd struggle to put together anything worth televising.'

The insider added that Jamie was then 'politely persuaded' by a producer to go against the 'truce', as they knew 'it would create fireworks'.

Pact: During the early days of filming in July, each of the men agreed they would no longer interrupt each other as they enjoyed alone time with Angie at cocktail parties

Drama: An on set source says: 'Some of the producers were furious when they found out and were scrambling to create drama and break up the truce'. Pictured: Angie Kent

According to the source, the men nicknamed Jamie 'the producers' pet' from that point onwards, and it did not help him make friends in the mansion.

In a preview for the episode, Jamie said: 'My intention for coming onto this show was not to be in the "bro zone" - it was to win Angie's heart. And I'll do whatever it takes.'

Timm Hanley fumed at him: 'You know what you're causing? You're causing another drama, and this is what we didn't want. Be the gentleman and sit back.'

'Producers pet': The insider added that Jamie Doran (pictured) was then 'politely persuaded' by a producer to go against the 'truce', as they knew 'it would create fireworks'

'What a dog, man,' Timm later added, as Jamie interrupted intruder Ryan Anderson's intimate chat with Angie.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Ten for comment.

The Bachelorette airs on Channel 10 at 7:30pm on Wednesday
